gameDetails.matchup: New York Jets @ New England Patriots

recentPerformance.hitRate: Thursday Night Football avg 39.2 points/game (21% below league avg)
recentPerformance.recentForm: Jets averaging 17.1 PPG over last 4 games
recentPerformance.cushion: Patriots defense ranks 3rd in points allowed (17.2 PPG)

keyFactors.title: Elite Defensive Matchup
keyFactors.description: Patriots defense ranks 3rd in points allowed (17.2 PPG), Jets rank 5th (18.1 PPG). Both units dominant, creating low-scoring environment.

keyFactors.title: Thursday Night Football Trend
keyFactors.description: TNF games average 39.2 total points (21% below league average). Short rest, travel fatigue, offensive inefficiency all contribute to lower scoring.

keyFactors.title: Weather Conditions
keyFactors.description: Foxborough forecast: 40Â°F with 15mph winds. Historical data shows wind speeds above 12mph reduce passing efficiency by ~12% and total scoring by 8.4%.

keyFactors.title: Run-Heavy Game Scripts
keyFactors.description: Both teams ranked top-10 in rush play percentage. Clock-controlling, run-first approach limits possessions and scoring opportunities.

keyFactors.title: Jets Offensive Struggles
keyFactors.description: Jets averaging just 17.1 PPG over last 4 games. Aaron Rodgers declining (1.2 TD:INT ratio), offensive line allowing 3.4 sacks/game.

riskFactors: Rodgers capable of vintage performance despite age
Patriots' offense improving under rookie QB Drake Maye
Divisional game could produce unexpected fireworks
Short week creates high variance scenarios

henderson.impact: 3 rushing TDs but stayed run-heavy, killing clock and limiting possessions

maye.impact: Efficient passing but Patriots stayed ground-based in blowout

quarterBreakdown.description: Low-scoring start. Jets scored TD on opening drive, Patriots answered with FG and TD. Total: 17 points through Q1.
Defensive battle. Only 7 points scored entire quarter (Patriots TD). Halftime total: 24 points - well under pace.
Jets scored TD, Patriots added FG. Total through 3 quarters: 34 points. Under looking comfortable.
Patriots added late TD to seal it. Only 7 points in Q4. Final: 41 total points.

gameResults.turningPoint: Patriots' time of possession dominance (34:18 vs 25:42) limited Jets to just 52 total plays. Defensive game script played out exactly as projected.
gameResults.gamePace: Slow-paced, run-heavy game. Patriots ran 71 plays (38 rushes), Jets ran just 52 plays (22 rushes). Clock control killed scoring opportunities.

whatWentRight.title: Defensive Dominance Delivered
whatWentRight.description: Both defenses played elite football. Patriots held Jets to 14 points, Jets defense stayed competitive despite losing. Exactly as modeled.

whatWentRight.title: Run-Heavy Game Script
whatWentRight.description: Patriots ran 38 times, controlling clock for 34:18. Jets got just 52 total plays. Ground-and-pound approach limited possessions perfectly.

whatWentRight.title: Weather Impact Confirmed
whatWentRight.description: 15mph winds reduced passing efficiency. Both QBs avoided high-volume passing attacks, confirming weather thesis.

whatWentRight.title: Thursday Night Trend Held
whatWentRight.description: 41 total points fits perfectly into TNF average of 39.2 points. Short-week offensive struggles were real.

statisticalContext.vsSeasonAverage: Jets scored 14 vs 19.2 season avg. Patriots scored 27 vs 21.8 season avg. Total 41 vs 43.5 line.
statisticalContext.vsRecentForm: Jets scored 14 vs 17.1 recent avg (under). Patriots scored 27 vs 23.4 recent avg (slight over, but game script-driven).
statisticalContext.vsPropLine: Total came in 2.5 points under the 43.5 line. Comfortable winner.
statisticalContext.percentileRanking: 41-point total = 32nd percentile for NFL games this season (well below average)

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: This was NOT variance - this was the thesis playing out perfectly. Elite defenses, run-heavy scripts, weather impact, and TNF trends all converged exactly as predicted. Patriots went ground-heavy after getting ahead, Jets couldn't keep up offensively. Model predicted this outcome with high confidence.

closingLineValue.verdict: Positive CLV (+3 cents). Line moved slightly toward Under as sharp money came in. Good early price captured edge before market adjusted.

keyTakeaways: Thursday Night Football unders are REAL: Short rest creates offensive inefficiency
Weather matters: 15mph winds reduced passing game significantly as predicted
Elite defenses + run-heavy teams = under goldmine: Time of possession dominance killed scoring
Patriots' game script perfect: Went run-heavy after taking lead, controlled clock
Model accuracy: Projected 60% probability, game played out exactly as thesis stated
verdict: Textbook winner. Every thesis point materialized: elite defenses dominated, weather impacted passing, run-heavy scripts controlled clock, TNF trend held. Patriots' 38 rushes and 34:18 time of possession created exact low-scoring environment we projected. This is what sharp handicapping looks like - identify structural edges, bet with confidence when model aligns with market inefficiency. Grade: A+
